intro: Sphaeranthus stuhlmannii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and the flowers range in color from white to yellow. Sphaeranthus stuhlmannii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
